Garrisons of professional guards are given the duties of patrolling the streets, assisting citizenry, and acting as a quick military response in times of crisis. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 20 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 18 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 15 [City Guard Squadron](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3558) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 114 **Perception** +12 **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +14, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +11, [Settlement Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +9 **Str** +5 **Dex** +0 **Con** +3 **Int** +0 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +2 **Seek Quarry** City guards can spend 1 minute to designate a single creature for whom they have a physical description as their quarry. They gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks against their quarry. --- **AC** 22 **Fort** +14 **Ref** +9 **Will** +11 **HP** 75 (4 segments) **Weaknesses** area damage 5, [splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=699) damage 5 **[Troop Defenses](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=44)** --- **Speed** 25 feet; city passage, [troop movement](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=85) **City Passage** City guards ignore [difficult terrain](/Rules.aspx?ID=453) caused by crowds or from movement through narrow spaces such as alleyways. **Lower Halberds!** **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The city guards engage in a coordinated melee attack against each enemy in a 10-foot emanation, with a DC 19 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. The damage depends on the number of actions.
1d10 piercing or slashing damage
1d10+7 piercing or slashing damage
1d10+10 piercing or slashing damage **Shoot Crossbows!** The city guards draw or reload their crossbows, then launch a ranged attack in the form of a volley. This volley is a 10-foot burst within 120 feet that deals 2d8 piercing damage with a DC 19 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. When the city guards are reduced to 2 or fewer segments, this area decreases to a 5-foot burst.
Local Guards The city guard squadron depicted here consists of humans armed with halberds and crossbows. You can alter these details to match the settlements in your game, adding ancestry traits, regional languages, and other abilities as necessary, and swapping out their weaponry for ones appropriate to the local culture. Some of the ancestry entries in chapter 2 also include troops even more suited to settlements inhabited by different ancestries!
